title: Create a new reservation (Business request, not for a government official, MLB to Pay)
custom_preconds:
Given
User is signed in as MLB user
AND under the Events > Reservation Calendar, Select a team: Chicago Cubs, 
AND check mark 'Regular Season'
custom_steps:
WHEN
Go to and click on August 15, 2017
AND under the Event Reservations, click on '+New Reservation'
AND Is this a business request? Select 'Yes'
AND Business: Pick any business from the list, e.g. select 'Coke' (Or to add new business to the list, type the business name in the box below and click 'Add item', then select that  business name in the Business box) 
AND Tickets are for Government Official? Select 'No'
AND How do you want to process the tickets? Select 'MLB to Pay'
AND Quantity: '1' (Enter any number for number of reservation you want)
AND Perferred price per ticket/per ticket max: '10' (Any price, XX)
AND Will Call Recipient : William (Enter any name who will pick, XX)
AND Email Address of Ticket Recipient: qa.ticketing@gmail.com (Enter any email address)
AND Approving Supervisor: Chris (Enter any name, XX)
AND Comments: Leave blank Or (Enter any comment, e.g. 'MLB to Pay')
AND Click on 'Submit Request'
custom_expected:
THEN
A new Business 'MLB to Pay type reservation is made.

title: Verify that "Available" events display as "blue" on the event calendar
custom_preconds:
GIVEN 
User is signed in as MLB user
AND Under Events > Reservation Calendar
AND Select a team : Chicago Cubs
And Check mark Regular Season
custom_steps:
WHEN
Clicking on any Blue Color event in Calendar will direct you to Event Reservations
custom_expected:
THEN 
It will direct to Event Reservations, meaning available events are displayed with blue color

Note: Blue Color mean:Event Available, Black color mean:Event Blackout, Grey color mean:Event Expired.

title: Verify that "blackout" events display as "black" on the event calendar and a warning is displayed when attempting to create a reservation
custom_preconds:
GIVEN
User is signed as MLB user
AND under Events > Reservation Calendar
AND 'Select a team' : Chicago Cubs
AND check mark Regular Season
custom_steps:
WHEN 
Go to and Click on August 31st, 2017 event (shows black color)
AND Under the 'Event Reservations' click on '+ New Reservation'
custom_expected:
THEN 
A message is displayed, 'You are submittig a request for a black out game…….." The event color is black meaning it's blackout.


Note: The event will display as "black" on the calendar.  When making a reservation for the game, you will receive the message “You are submitting a request for a black out game. Please be advised that purchases may not be available for this date and it is the discretion of the Club. A personal request will only be fulfilled based on availability after business requests are fulfilled.” before filling out reservation information.

title: Verify that "expired" events display as "grey" on the event calendar and a reservation cannot be initiated
custom_preconds:
Given
User is signed in as MLB user
AND Events > Reservation Calendar,
AND Select a team : Chicago Cubs
AND check mark Regular Season
custom_steps:
WHEN 
Goto the grey color event August 30th, 2017 and click on it
custom_expected:
THEN
Nothing pops up, reservation cannot be initiated, it's an expired event. Grey color shows event has expired

title: Verify that ticket data is visible in the bam_comptix.t_track_history and t_tickets_details tables
custom_steps:
The below queries will assist in the identification of ticket records in the QA SHOP database.

select * from bam_comptix.t_users_boc where username = 'ctmlbuser@mlb.com' --userid 1294321253
select * from bam_comptix.t_track_history where create_user_id ='1294321253' and reservation_id in ('3142252600') order by create_date desc;
select * from bam_comptix.t_tickets_details where reservation_id in ('3142252600') order by create_date desc -- Ticket_ID 4450
custom_expected:
The "t_track_history" table will show Admin actions related to ticket assignment (ex: Add/View).
The "t_tickets_details" table will show detail about the ticketing attached to the reservation (ex: ticket name, deleted, visible).

title: Verify that ticket data is visible in the bam_comptix.t_track_history and t_tickets_details tables
custom_steps:
The below queries will assist in the identification of ticket records in the QA SHOP database.

select * from bam_comptix.t_users_boc where username = 'ctbocuser@mlb.com' --userid 715362101
select * from bam_comptix.t_track_history where create_user_id ='715362101' and reservation_id in ('2406518421') order by create_date desc
select * from bam_comptix.t_tickets_details where reservation_id in ('2406518421') order by create_date desc -- TICKET_ID 4853
custom_expected:
The "t_track_history" table will show Admin actions related to ticket assignment (ex: Add/View).
The "t_tickets_details" table will show detail about the ticketing attached to the reservation (ex: ticket name, deleted, visible).
